intro: Luisia zeylanica, commonly known as the Ceylon balsam, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its erect stems and alternate leaves that are usually ovate or elliptic in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically in racemes, and come in shades of white or pink. Luisia zeylanica is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
